metadata.synopsis: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.

182.speaker: Arabella
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

237.speaker: Rath
237.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...
237.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

45.speaker: Kagha
45.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

76.speaker: Kagha
76.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *A death viper. You have milked their poison before. A single drop of it could kill that child in a heartbeat.*
79.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Thief? Poison? What's this girl's actual crime?
143.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

31.speaker: Kagha
31.text: She eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!

209.speaker: Player
209.text: Imprison her? She's just a child.
209.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

207.speaker: Player
207.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

88.speaker: Kagha
88.text: Tell me, Blade. Is the healer cruel for ridding the sick of disease?

53.speaker: Player
53.text: She's not a disease - she's a child.

220.speaker: Kagha
220.text: They are a blight, each and all. If I cannot choke it out, I will burn it away.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You're no healer. And you're no judge either. Let her go.

214.speaker: Kagha
214.text: The blight must be cut away for healing to begin. First, the spawn. The rest will follow.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: This isn't my kind of justice... but I won't stand in your way.

38.speaker: Player
38.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

138.speaker: Player
138.text: One of your guards outside said you wanted to see me. Here I am.
138.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

183.speaker: Kagha
183.text: We will speak soon enough. First, judgement must be passed.
183.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

10.speaker: Kagha
10.text: The parasite eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!
10.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

5.speaker: Kagha
5.text: Rath - lock her up. She remains here until the rite is complete.
5.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

75.speaker: Kagha
75.text: And keep still, devil. Teela is restless.
75.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

236.speaker: Rath
236.text: Come, Kagha. We took back the idol. Surely...
236.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

172.speaker: Kagha
172.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *The death of a child. A timeless tragedy that never grows old.*
131.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Flick your eyes to the exit so the child will try to run.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Your mind wants the snake to kill the child. But your heart doesn't. Snap out of it.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Her life matters more than satiating your dark fantasies. You focus and they're gone. But clearly, this child's life is in danger.*

139.speaker: Player
139.text: You've proven your authority. Now prove your mercy.
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

234.speaker: Kagha
234.text: Fair words. Child, take to the others word of my grace. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Free the whelp, or I run your belly through with a blade.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: The girl is no threat. Jailing her disrupts nature's balance.
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Don't druids cherish harmony? Jailing the girl disrupts nature's balance.
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Don't druids cherish harmony? Jailing the girl disrupts nature's balance.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

231.speaker: Kagha
231.text: I hear the Treefather's spirit in your words.
231.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

242.speaker: Kagha
242.text: I hear the Treefather's spirit in your words.

40.text: The devil sowed chaos. She remains until the rite is complete!
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

100.speaker: Kagha
100.text: The devil sowed chaos. She remains until the rite is complete!
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

127.speaker: Kagha
127.text: *The snake's hiss of approval reveals its intentions. Should the child struggle, it is poised to strike.*
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: *The snake's hiss of approval reveals its intentions. Should the child struggle, it is poised to strike.*
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *The snake's hiss of approval reveals its intentions. Should the child struggle, it is poised to strike.*
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

229.speaker: Narrator
229.text: *The snake's hiss of approval reveals its intentions. Should the child struggle, it is poised to strike.*
229.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Your snake is prepared to kill this child. Do you want her death on your hands?

189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

160.speaker: Narrator
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Imprisoning her empowers the refugees. Are you willing to risk insurrection?

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Call off your snake or it goes in my dinner pot tonight.

154.speaker: Kagha
154.text: You dare speak of Teela in this manner?

158.text: You dare speak of Teela in this manner?

106.speaker: Kagha
106.text: You dare speak of Teela in this manner?

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Let the child go, so she can spread word to the others of your might.
111.context: NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

28.speaker: Kagha
28.text: Yes. She is more valuable out there than in here. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
28.context: NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

235.speaker: Kagha
235.text: Yes. She is more valuable out there than in here. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
235.context: NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

244.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Kagha's line, |Rath tries to grab the child, but the child breaks away, and the snakes lunge for her. She collapses on the spot; Rath runs to her in a panic.|

50.speaker: Kagha
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Kagha's line, |Rath tries to grab the child, but the child breaks away, and the snakes lunge for her. She collapses on the spot; Rath runs to her in a panic.|

141.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Kagha's line, |Rath tries to grab the child, but the child breaks away, and the snakes lunge for her. She collapses on the spot; Rath runs to her in a panic.|

180.speaker: Rath
180.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Rath tries to revive the child, but with no success.|

2.speaker: Kagha
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the line, we see Sagha rubbing her head and considering what to do. This should be a nice long pause. Then she becomes EVIL for good.NodeContext: AY-thyas. Draconian language for SHIT!

121.speaker: Rath
121.text: Gone. By the gods, Kagha, what have you done?
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rath looks to Kagha, appalled by what has happened.

190.speaker: Kagha
190.text: Bury the remains. Continue the rite.

114.speaker: Rath
114.text: And the parents? They're just outside...

161.speaker: Kagha
161.text: This outsider will take word once I've spoken to them. We must focus on the rite.

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *The corpse is frozen in her final moment of agony. Well, at least you tried.*

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Let the child go, so she can spread word to the others of your might.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

197.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

184.speaker: Kagha
184.text: Very well - she may go. Break your word, and my serpent shall feed. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

21.speaker: Kagha
21.text: Very well - she may go. Break your word, and my serpent shall feed. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

166.text: No - the tiefling remains until the rite is complete.

15.speaker: Kagha
15.text: No - the tiefling remains until the rite is complete.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: A seed nobly sown renders the sweetest fruit. Be noble - set her free.
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: First line to player, Second to snake. The snake then slithers to the side of KaghaNodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: A seed nobly sown renders the sweetest fruit. Be noble - set her free.

86.speaker: Kagha
86.text: The words of the Treefather, spoken plain.

221.speaker: Kagha
221.text: It is as you say. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
221.context: CinematicNodeContext: First line to player, Second to snake. The snake then slithers to the side of KaghaNodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

134.speaker: Kagha
134.text: Out, thief. My grace has its limits.
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

163.speaker: Player
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

109.speaker: Narrator
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *But was it truly nothing?  The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

199.speaker: Narrator
199.text: *A hot spike of pain overcomes you, and a strange image is thrust upon your mind's eye. You are a frightened little girl, in a dark chamber. A hooded figure approaches, brandishing a rod...*
199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memory fragment - SH recalls being punished and  chastisted in the Sharran Grotto.

46.speaker: Player
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

135.speaker: Player
135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Thank you, Kagha. Master Halsin would...

34.speaker: Rath
34.text: Thank you, Kagha. Master Halsin would...

219.speaker: Kagha
219.text: Halsin isn't here. Keep his name off your tongue, lest Teela pierce it.

68.text: I've heard enough. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

137.speaker: Kagha
137.text: I've heard enough. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I am versed in the ways of justice. Make your case, and I will pass judgement.
99.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

250.speaker: Kagha
250.text: Very well. I'll defer to your ruling.
250.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

57.speaker: Kagha
57.text: Very well. I'll defer to your ruling.
57.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

16.speaker: Kagha
16.text: My circle has offered grace to these outsiders. We gave them shelter from storm, we nourished their bellies.
16.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

78.speaker: Kagha
78.text: In return, these devils lured in a horde of goblins, and their spawn stole the one relic that might keep us safe.
78.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

47.speaker: Kagha
47.text: We've taken back our relic. But I will keep the fiend caged 'til our protection rite is complete.
47.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

193.speaker: Player
193.text: What do you have to say for yourself, child?
193.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I am ready to pass judgement.
93.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

146.speaker: Arabella
146.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

147.speaker: Player
147.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

25.speaker: Arabella
25.text: I - I was scared. They said when the rite was over, we'd have to leave.
25.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

152.speaker: Arabella
152.text: But there's goblins out there, and worse. And it's nice here, so I - I took the idol. I thought maybe then we could stay.
152.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

83.speaker: Arabella
83.text: Please, let me go. I'll be good, I swear.
83.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

17.speaker: Kagha
17.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Justice means nothing without mercy. Let her go.
60.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

35.speaker: Arabella
35.text: Thank you thank you thank you!

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Return the girl to her family. She's made amends, and you have your relic.
136.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Cage the girl. It's a fitting response to the crime she committed.
18.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

247.speaker: Arabella
247.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Unfortunate, but temporary. Detain her for only as long as necessary.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: This isn't justice, this is cruelty. Let the child go.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: The girl has made her amends. Return her to her family.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Imprisonment is an appropriate punishment for theft. Lock her up.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Unfortunate, but temporary. Detain her for only as long as necessary.

179.text: I did not ask for counsel. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

142.speaker: Kagha
142.text: I did not ask for counsel. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You act rashly - as a cornered viper would. Free the child or more tieflings will interrupt you.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She shrinks back slightly in the face of such unexpected furyNodeContext: Cowed but trying not to show/sound it

95.text: Tsk. A gathered herd of the devils would indeed be disruptive.

52.speaker: Kagha
52.text: Tsk. A gathered herd of the devils would indeed be disruptive.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Silvanus was more concerned with 'nobly sown seeds' than punishing children, was He not?
171.context: CinematicNodeContext: She shrinks back slightly in the face of such unexpected furyNodeContext: Cowed but trying not to show/sound it

104.text: I've treated with beasts with more etiquette than you.

26.speaker: Kagha
26.text: I've treated with beasts with more etiquette than you.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: *It's no use - the rage clouds all.*

148.speaker: Player
148.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

4.speaker: Kagha
4.text: Halsin is gone - I am First Druid now. I will take control and prove my authority.

226.speaker: Kagha
226.text: Halsin is gone - I am First Druid now. I will take control and prove my authority.

49.text: You intrude on the circle. You intrude on my mind.

238.speaker: Kagha
238.text: You intrude on the circle. You intrude on my mind.

196.speaker: Kagha
196.text: More proof that outsiders must never be trusted.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Tell the snake to be at ease. The girl must not be harmed.
90.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

249.speaker: Teela
249.text: Silence. I answer only to mistress.
249.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Tell the snake to put Kagha at ease. The girl belongs with her own brood.
64.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

32.speaker: Teela
32.text: A new hatchling? Yes. They can be foolish.
32.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

19.speaker: Teela
19.text: Kagha si nay. Wux geou fulla wer fanol.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: To KaghaNodeContext: To Kagha. Draconic snakey language. KA-ga see-NAY. wooks gyow fulla wur FAN-ole.

248.speaker: Kagha
248.text: Ssifisv - it is as you say, Teela. Come to me.
248.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Teela the snake. A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.NodeContext: To Teela the snake. A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

107.text: Let judgement be cast. Spill blood after, if you must.

175.speaker: Narrator
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players and druids both enter combat stance.

118.speaker: Player
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players and druids both enter combat stance.

223.speaker: Lae'zel
223.text: Wise. To know, we must first observe.

174.speaker: Shadowheart
174.text: Good. Play nice until we get what we need.

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: That's it. You're calm, I'm calm, snake's calm.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Don't be a coward. We could take them. We could kill them all.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: Remand the thief. I will not say it again.

201.speaker: Kagha
201.text: Remand the thief. I will not say it again.

204.speaker: Wyll
204.text: A fickle one, aren't you? I hope you know what you're doing.

216.speaker: Gale
216.text: Good. Let's focus on the girl first. We can settle with the snake later.

185.speaker: Player
185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players and druids both enter combat stance.

245.speaker: Kagha
245.text: The outlander must strike on Zevlor's behalf! Call the circle to arms - we will cleanse the grove of parasites, once and for all.
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players and druids both enter combat stance.

41.speaker: Kagha
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: After line, snake bares fangs (if possible) and combat begins.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: Leave it. Remember why we're here.

232.speaker: Karlach
232.text: Wait! Don't spook the gods-damn snake!

165.speaker: Wyll
165.text: This Kagha's barbaric. Know this: I've got your back.

97.speaker: Gale
97.text: Hold on! It's not too late to settle this without bloodshed.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: To reject the helpless is to reject Silvanus himself.

208.speaker: Kagha
208.text: The Treefather's words spoken with a devil's forked tongue.

96.speaker: Kagha
96.text: Perhaps you don't know that Silvanus spoke further. 'The parasite must be removed for new seed to grow.'

103.speaker: Kagha
103.text: The Treefather's words. Your circle taught well.

67.speaker: Kagha
67.text: You know, then, that Silvanus spoke further. 'The parasite must be removed for new seed to grow.'

192.speaker: Kagha
192.text: Yet behold: the parasite lives! She eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!
